item.title: 10 Best RPGs With Time Management Mechanics, Ranked
item.description:
Games often create diverse mechanics to engage players, ranging from simpler systems like leveling up and character skills to more complex ones such as item crafting or base building. These mechanics not only enhance gameplay but also encourage exploration and experimentation, sustaining interest over extended periods.

In the RPG genre, some games even incorporate time management mechanics, requiring players to carefully choose how they spend their time to achieve desired outcomes. Selecting the actions their characters take is fundamental in the long term, with some of the best games delivering challenging yet rewarding time management mechanics.

10 Shin Megami Tensei: Devil Survivor 2

Modern Apocalypse Where Time Is Precious

Atlus has skillfully integrated time management mechanics in various titles, with Devil Survivor 2 standing as a prime example. This spin-off from the Shin Megami Tensei series plunges players into a desperate race against time, where every decision is a matter of life and death as an impending apocalypse looms.

Time becomes increasingly limited and precious, with each event advancing the clock, compelling players to select between battles, negotiations, and social interactions. These choices directly influence the narrative, leading to various outcomes as the story unfolds, making time management pivotal in determining the characters' fates and the game's ultimate conclusion.

9 Atelier Ayesha: The Alchemist Of Dusk DX

Time And Alchemy In A Dying World

Atelier Ayesha: The Alchemist of Dusk DX follows Ayesha as she balances her alchemical tasks with the search for her missing sister. The game emphasizes the importance of careful time management, requiring players to plan each action to make the most of the in-game calendar.

Players must wisely choose between gathering ingredients and synthesizing items, creating a compelling challenge where time optimization is crucial. Despite the focus on efficient time management, the game maintains the series' signature relaxing pace and welcoming atmosphere, offering an engaging experience that rewards thoughtful planning without unnecessary stress.

8 Final Fantasy Type-0

Superficial Time Management Mechanics

Final Fantasy Type-0 introduces a time management system that becomes essential to maximizing the gaming experience. The time available between main missions is limited, and each optional action, such as special conversations or excursions from the base, consumes hours of that time. This forces players to make strategic choices to make the most of the opportunities.

This mechanic not only increases the challenge but also encourages replayability, as it is impossible to complete all activities in a single playthrough. By carefully planning actions, players can explore different paths and unlock new content with each new playthrough.

7 Harvestella

Essential Time Mechanics For RPG Progression

Time mechanics in Harvestella are crucial for making progress in the game. Time passes rapidly, with each minute in the real world equating to an hour in-game. Whether cultivating crops or exploring dungeons, every action consumes a significant portion of the day, forcing players to plan their activities carefully.

As with other farming simulators, effective use of the clock and calendar is required for players to complete all planned activities. It’s worth noting that Harvestella also offers items like the Return Ball, which allows players to move around the map more quickly to gain a few precious minutes in their day-to-day activities.

6 Eternights

Action RPG With Strong Persona Inspiration

  • Plataforms: PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, PC
  • Released: September 12, 2023
  • Developers: Studio Sai
  • Genre: Action RPG

Eternights blends RPG elements with time management mechanics in a post-apocalyptic setting. Each day, players must choose between exploring dungeons, seeking resources, and strengthening bonds with other characters, all while time continues to tick away. This balance between tasks creates a dynamic experience, where each choice can directly impact progress in the game.

The time management mechanic in Eternights shines by forcing critical decisions in a high-pressure environment. With time limits for each area and constant challenges, players need to prioritize their actions strategically. In this way, the game not only tests combat skills but also challenges the ability to manage time efficiently.

5 Citizen Sleeper

Time Is Crucial In A Cyberpunk Future

In Citizen Sleeper , players face the challenge of managing time within a decaying space station — and a decaying body. This RPG combines time management elements with a rich narrative, where every cycle is significant. From resource management to social interactions, every decision impacts survival on Erlin's Eye.

The mechanics of Citizen Sleeper impose difficult choices, where time becomes a scarce resource that players must use wisely. Actions are tracked by clocks that determine the impact of decisions, making each cycle vital in shaping the future within this unforgiving environment. The game is ideal for those who appreciate deep stories set in dystopian futures.

4 Rune Factory 4

Balancing Farm Life And The Call Of Adventure

Most farming simulators share a common element, requiring players to manage their time between exploring the map, interacting with characters, and tending to crops. The Rune Factory games are no different, but Rune Factory 4 also adds the need to find time to explore the game's dungeons.

The blend of these elements, along with a strong focus on combat variety and an intriguing story, makes the game unique within the RPG genre. Additionally, the time management mechanic is essential for balancing daily tasks, so players must carefully schedule their interactions while also exploring dungeons and advancing the story.

3 Fire Emblem: Three Houses

Time Management Brought A New Element To The Iconic Franchise

The first game in the franchise to arrive on the Nintendo Switch, Fire Emblem: Three Houses introduced several new features, with the introduction of a calendar being a standout. Players assume the role of Byleth, a newly hired professor at the Officers Academy, and they need to manage their time between interactions with students and strategic battles.

While not as complex as Persona , the game competently represents the passage of time. During free days, players can use activity points to perform various actions, such as strengthening affinity bonds, collecting items, or gathering characters to face enemy troops on the map. These mechanics add depth and variety to time management, enhancing the overall gaming experience.

2 Pathfinder: Kingmaker

The Tough Choices Of Being A Ruler

Developed by Owlcat Games and set in the Golarion universe, Pathfinder: Kingmaker is an isometric RPG that effectively utilizes the passage of time. From the journey's outset, players have a deadline to defeat the Stag Lord and liberate the Stolen Lands from bandit control.

While the initial deadline is generous, the time to complete each task becomes more constrained once crowned as regent of the region. This forces players to balance kingdom administration with regional exploration, addressing threats that cannot be handled solely from the throne room. Thus, time management is crucial for success throughout this RPG adventure.

1 Persona 4 Golden

A Franchise Renowned For Time Management

Although the franchise is the major reference for RPG time management, Persona 4 Golden is the one that best captures the slice of life quality. Here, players assume the role of Yu Narukami, a student transferred to the town of Inaba, who becomes embroiled in a murder investigation and the use of supernatural powers.

Over nearly a year, players must divide their time between completing Social Links, studying, and uncovering the mysteries behind the fog and its connection to the murders in Inaba. Persona 4 Golden also features engaging characters and an incredible soundtrack, making the experience of navigating each day all the more rewarding.

item.title: Path Of Exile: Best Ranger Builds
item.description:
Grinding Gear Games' mammoth ARPG Path of Exile is well-known for taking build diversity seriously. After over a decade's worth of consistent updates, fresh mechanics introduced with every season, and a sequel on the way, this spiritual successor to the Diablo series hooked players with a seemingly endless wealth of choices and unprecedented theorycrafting. It really does cater to every possible style of play.

However, even with all that potential, some builds are clearly better than others and have secured their spot in the meta because of their ability to clear entire maps in mere minutes. The bow-wielding Ranger and her Ascendancy classes fit the bill quite nicely. Starting with the highest Dexterity and as swift as the arrows she looses, she's a great pick for tackling any content. Below are some of the best builds for the Ranger.

6 Flicker Strike Raider

A Cold-Based Ranger Build With Frenzy Charges

  • Uses Forbidden Shako to convert physical damage to cold.
  • Stacks Frenzy charges with Farrul's Fur.
  • Wields a Paradoxica with elemental penetration.

The Flicker Strike Raider is a powerful Ranger build that's been around for its fair share of Leagues now, and for good reason - it's ability to blitz through all the content is almost unparalleled. The bulk of its power comes from a specific Forbidden Shako setup that swaps all physical damage to cold, including the normally physical Flicker Strike skill.

Wearing Farrul's Fur armor pushes damage even further by increasing the uptime on Frenzy Charges, making the Avatar of the Slaughter passive from the Raider Ascendancy tree absolutely lethal. Plus, wielding a Paradoxica Vaal Rapier (preferably with elemental penetration) means cold skill hit even harder on top of all that. While it's not one particularly suited for the start of a new League, the potentially insane damage output is sure to pique player interest.

5 Caustic Arrow Pathfinder

Deals Chaos Damage Over Time In A Targeted Area

  • Uses Nature's Reprisal to inflict the Wither status.
  • Wears the Lightning Coil armor for extra defense.
  • Wields the Widowhail bow.

Inflicting Chaos damage that eats away at enemy health over time is the basis of the Caustic Arrow Pathfinder build, and it's one that's very satisfying for players who prefer damage-over-time strategies. Slotting the Caustic Arrow gem lets players rain down projectiles in a targeted area, inflicting Chaos damage upfront while draining their remaining life with a lingering ground effect.

The Nature's Reprisal node from the Pathfinder Ascendancy skill tree allows the Ranger to inflict Wither on targets, increasing the Chaos damage they take and improving its effectiveness by 50%. This makes it a decent League starter, although survivability isn't the build's strongest aspect. However, wearing the Lightning Coil armor converts half of physical damage taken to lightning, making it easier to stay alive. Players should also look out for a Widowhail bow and a quiver with a damage-over-time multiplier to get the most out of this build.

4 Tornado Shot Deadeye

Looses Piercing Projectiles In All Directions

  • Gains elemental penetration from a Crystallized Omniscience.
  • Wears the Black Sun Crest to boost stats.
  • Makes use of Ensnaring Arrow and Frenzy for increased damage.

While Tornado Shot has seen its fair share of tweaks and outright nerfs, especially in the Necropolis League, it remains a powerful bow skill when paired with the Deadeye. That's because it still packs a punch that can completely wipe the screen clean. Players should be on the lookout for a Crystallized Omniscience amulet for its elemental penetration bonus, while the Black Sun Crest helmet gives the Ranger a substantial boost to her stats across the board.

The Manaforged Arrows support gem can also be slotted alongside Ensnaring Arrow and Frenzy to further increase damage output, since this will build up Frenzy Charges and cause enemies to take 20% more damage from projectiles. Be warned though, this build can be quite costly and require a couple of Mirrors of Kalandra, so it's best suited as a second or third character during a League.

3 Toxic Rain Pathfinder

Creates Deadly Spore Pods To Spread Chaos Damage

  • Wears the Lightning Coil armor for extra defense.
  • Boosts resistances with Impossible Escape.
  • Uses Petrified Blood to stagger any damage taken.

Similar to Caustic Arrow, the Toxic Rain skill calls down a barrage of deadly projectiles at the target location. But here's the twist - it also creates Spore Pods that deal chaos damage-over-time to any enemy dumb enough to wander into it. And any gear that increases a skill's area of effect also makes the Spore Pods bigger, meaning they cover a wider area. The sweet spot to aim for is 39% increased AoE so they don't overlap too much.

For survivability, the trusty Lightning Coil armor converts 50% of physical damage to lightning, while the Impossible Escape Viridian Jewel boosts elemental resistances. On top of that, this build can take advantage of the Petrified Blood spell to protect the lower half of its health pool, causing instant damage to instead be spread out over time instead. For a League start, players will rely on a Ballista Totem setup to fire Toxic Rain until they gather the right gear and skill gems.

2 Elemental Hit of the Spectrum Deadeye

Deals Three Types Of Elemental Damage At Once

  • Inflicts the Freeze, Shock and Ignite statuses.
  • Works with lots of different skill gems.
  • Uses Manaforged Arrows to fill the screen with projectiles.

Introduced in the Necropolis League, Elemental Hit of the Spectrum is a special Transfigured gem that lets players deal three different types of elemental damage at the same time. This allows the Ranger to inflict the Freeze, Shock and Ignite status effects at once without relying on a tri-element bow. Plus, the skill deals even more damage based on how many elemental statuses are applied to the enemy.

The beauty of this build is in its versatility. Players can pretty much choose whatever bow skill gems they like to trigger Elemental Hit of the Spectrum, including Blast Rain, Storm Rain, and Ensnaring Arrow. Add in a Nimis topaz ring, the Headhunter leather belt, or a Mageblood heavy belt alongside the Manaforged Arrows support skill and this Ranger can fill the entire screen with projectiles.

1 Lightning Arrow Deadeye

Hits Enemies Multiple Times With Elemental Damage

  • Uses Crystallized Omniscience to increase penetration.
  • Slots Returning Projectiles gem to hit multiple times.
  • Wears Hydrri's Ire for extra spell suppression and cold damage.

Aside from its insane damage potential, the thing that makes a Lightning Arrow build so enticing is just how easy it is to set up. Players can put this build together with minimal effort, since they can rely on gear found during the main campaign. That means fewer headaches from farming. It uses a tri-element bow with the Trinity support gem to increase elemental damage and elemental penetration. Then, piercing and the Returning Projectiles gem allow arrows to hit every enemy twice.

While this setup is fantastic at clearing maps, it's lacking in single-target scenarios. Slotting the Artillery Ballista gem, however, lets this build comfortably deal with bosses. At endgame, players should look for the Crystallized Omniscience amulet to boost elemental penetration even further, and combine that with the Hydrri's Ire armor for an additional 30% spell suppression and added cold damage.

item.title: Madden NFL 25: 5 Best Linebackers, Ranked
item.description:
Highlights

  • Linebackers in Madden NFL 25 play crucial roles in defense, with different positions and strengths to stop opponents effectively.
  • Players like Khalil Mack, Demario Davis, Roquan Smith, T.J. Watt, and Fred Warner are top-rated stars with unique abilities and attributes.
  • Superstar X-Factor players like Demario and Roquan bring special skills like Reinforcement and Zone Hawk, enhancing gameplay strategies.

Madden NFL 25 features over 20 different positions. Coaches will need the right players for the job when deciding which plays will be best suited for shutting down their opponents. They will deploy multiple linebackers on their side of the field along with their best Safeties to keep their opponent from gaining distance on them.

There are 3 kinds of linebackers to be aware of: Middle linebackers, Left Outside linebackers, and right outside linebackers . These players will be utilized differently, but they will work together to form a solid defense. Middle linebackers are a key option for stopping an opponent team’s running back, while outer linebackers will be able to blitz into the opposing team’s offense.

5 Khalil Mack

Overall Rating: 90

Attribute Category

Rating

Overall

90

General

89

Passing-specific

11

Receiving

32

Ball-Carrying

50

Defense

77

Blocking

49

Kicking

19

Khalil Mack is a right outside linebacker for the Los Angeles Chargers and has steadily dropped in Overall performance since Madden NFL 20 — where he had an overall of 99 . Despite this sharp decline, he is still a great linebacker to have in place. Linebackers need to provide a solid defense, and his highest rated Attribute for his Defense category is his Power Moves . This attribute will help him get through the opponent team’s linemen — both on offense and defense.

Khalil Mack is a Superstar player , meaning that they will have access to some special abilities. Edge Threat, No Outsiders, and Strip Specialist are great options for coaches to work into their plays while using Khalil, especially to throw a wrench into their opponent's offensive plays.

4 Demario Davis

Overall Rating: 92

Attribute Category

Rating

Overall

92

General

90

Passing-specific

10

Receiving

19

Ball-Carrying

36

Defense

76

Blocking

48

Kicking

19

Demario Davis is a middle linebacker for the New Orleans Saints and has been part of the video game series since Madden NFL 13 — where his Overall Rating has fluctuated. When it comes to Defensive Attributes, his highest stat is his Play Recognition with a 96. This Attribute will determine how well Demario will be able to read his opponents. He also has an Awareness of 98, which will determine how well he will react. This is an amazing pairing for any player to have.

Unlike Khalil, Demario is not just a Superstar player, he is a Superstar X-Factor Player . This means that he has a really powerful card up his sleeve alongside regular Superstar abilities. Demario will be able to make use of the Superstar X-Factor ability called Reinforcement . Using this ability, whenever Demario enters the zone, he will have an increased chance of defeating run blocks — as well as disrupting catches through tackling.

3 Roquan Smith

Overall Rating: 95

Attribute Category

Rating

Overall

95

General

89

Passing-specific

12

Receiving

30

Ball-Carrying

42

Defense

79

Blocking

47

Kicking

15

Roquan Smith is a middle linebacker for the Baltimore Ravens and, since Madden NFL 19 , has done a great job of rising up to a solid Overall Rating of 95. It is very hard for a player to get into the covered 99 club, but any player that gets 95 or higher is one of the best players in the world of football. Out of all his Defensive Attributes, his highest rated is his Tackle .

This Attribute will determine how successful a player is in tackling their target. Combine this with his 90 rating in Acceleration and 98 rating in Stamina , and it's easy to see why he ranks so high up. Just like Demario, Roquan is a Superstar X-Factor player, and he makes use of the same Superstar X-Factor ability, Reinforcement .

2 T.J. Watt

Overall Rating: 97

Attribute Category

Rating

Overall

97

General

88

Passing-specific

10

Receiving

35

Ball-Carrying

44

Defense

82

Blocking

45

Kicking

38

T.J. Watt is a left outside linebacker for the Pittsburgh Steelers and the only left outside linebacker to have a rating in the 90s. He has steadily raised his Overall rating from a 74 from his appearance in Madden NFL 18 , up to an astonishing 97 rating . When it comes to Defensive Attributes, his highest stat is his Play Recognition with a 98 alongside a high rated Awareness . However, unlike Demario, T.J. has an Awareness that goes all the way up to a 99.

Out of all the Left Outside Linebacker in the game, only 3 are Superstar players, and out of those 3 Superstar players, only T.J. is a Superstar X-Factor player. Just like the two entries before him, T.J. will have access to a Superstar X-Factor ability, with his being called Unstoppable Force . Once T.J. enters the zone, this ability will increase his win rate and block shed speed when he is up against one-on-one pass blocks. Gamers will want players of this caliber when they feel it has come time to increase the game’s difficulty.

1 Fred Warner

Overall Rating: 97

Attribute Category

Rating

Overall

97

General

90

Passing-specific

8

Receiving

34

Ball-Carrying

Defense

79

46

Kicking

Fred Warner is middle linebacker for the San Fransisco 49ers and has raised his Overall Rating from a 71 in Madden NFL 19 , up to his highest rating to date . When it comes to Defensive Attributes, he has two ratings at a value of 99. These are his Play Recognition and his Pursuit . Pursuit will determine how well a player is able to chase down a ball carrier. To make him even more of a threat, he also has a 92 rating for his Speed, a 97 rating for his Stamina , and a 99 rating for his Awareness .

It’s no surprise that Fred is also a Superstar X-Factor player, and the Superstar X-Factor ability he makes use of is called Zone Hawk . When Fred enters the zone, he will have an increased rate of success for interceptions in zone coverage. With the right sliders, this can make for some of the best looking interceptions.

item.title: Fallout London: All Magazine Locations
item.description:
Fallout London is a massive mod for the Fallout 4 game that was released by Bethesda. The mod follows the story of the Wayfarer, the mod's version of the Sole Survivor, which needs to figure out how to navigate post-war London, England.

The mod offers a wide variety of collectibles in the game, such as vinyls and beer coasters. Players will have a ton to interact with and explore. Here's how to find and use magazines in the game.

Fallout London Magazines, Explained

Here is a breakdown of every magazine in the game and what they do.

Some have their locations labeled as "unknown," these will be updated as soon as they are found in the game.

All Magazine Series & What They Do

  • 005 - Adds to Infiltration
  • Anarchy Times - Lowers merchant prices
  • Charo Miami - Increases health or damage for companions
  • Constable Cruel - Increases damage to enemy limbs
  • Curl Up & Dye - Adds new hairstyles at barbers
  • DIY: The Householder's Handbook - Adds new items to make at workshops
  • Dan Rage - Decreases amount of damage companions take
  • Gibbs - Add new functionality to terminals
  • London Crime Statistics - Increases melee and unarmed damage
  • Ministry of National Health - Increases HP
  • Protect and Survive - Adds different survival perks
  • Ranger Ridiculous - Increases Marksman perk
  • The London Locksmith - Increases lockpicking chance
  • Trendy Tattoos - Unlocks tattoos

All Magazines & Their Locations In Fallout London

item.title: New York Times Connections Hints and Answers for #436 August 20, 2024
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Words in the NYT Connections Puzzle #436 for August 20, 2024
  • Hints for the NYT Connections Puzzle
  • Answers for Today's NYT Connections #436 for August 20, 2024

Connections has another puzzle today that features sixteen difficult words that need to go into four secret categories. Without any clues, you will need to figure where each word goes without making more than three mistakes.

If that seems too challenging for you, you can find tons of helpful clues in the guide below. It is designed to help you as little or as much as you like, giving you everything from general hints to the full answer to the puzzle. No matter what you need to solve this minimalist puzzle game, you can find it here.

Words in the NYT Connections Puzzle #436 for August 20, 2024

The Connections puzzle for today contains the words: Cat, Crank, Blow, Pop, Lion, Grinch, Wind, Turtle, Crab, Reel, Draft, Ram, Puff, Bull, Turn, and Gust.

Hints for the NYT Connections Puzzle

If you are familiar with the rules of how to play Connections , you know that those four mistakes you get can run out fast. Here are some helpful clues to get you closer to the answer before you run out.

Some General Hints for the Whole Connections Puzzle

Yellow NYT Connections Category Hints

Yellow Connections Category Answer

Yellow Connections Category Answer and All Four Words

Green NYT Connections Category Hints

Green Connections Category Answer

Green Connections Category Answer and All Four Words

Blue NYT Connections Category Hints

Blue Connections Category Answer

Blue Connections Category Answer and All Four Words

Purple NYT Connections Category Hints

Purple Connections Category Answer

Purple Connections Category Answer and All Four Words

Answers for Today's NYT Connections #436 for August 20, 2024

If you just want to see the complete answer to this iPhone-friendly puzzle game, this is the right place. The section below has the full answer, including the categories and all the words that go in them.

Want to play? Check out the New York Times Games Connections website, available on almost any device with a browser.
